org.itsnat.core.domutil

Class ItsNatDOMUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.itsnat.core.domutil.ItsNatDOMUtil

  • public class ItsNatDOMUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides methods to do frequent DOM related tasks. Most of them access DOM Element objects filtering/ignoring any other node type.
    Author:
    Jose Maria Arranz Santamaria

    • Constructor Summary

      ItsNatDOMUtil()

      • ItsNatDOMUtil

    • Method Detail

      • getElementById

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element getElementById(java.lang.String id,
                                 org.w3c.dom.Node container)
        Returns the first element with the specified id attribute below or the same as the specified node.

        Use this method when several elements in the tree have the same id attribute (duplicated id) because Document.getElementById(String) returns the first one.

        Parameters:
        id - the id attribute value to search.
        container - the top most node to search below.
        Returns:
        the first element object with the specified id or null if not found.

      • createElement

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element createElement(java.lang.String tagName,
                                java.lang.String text,
                                org.w3c.dom.Document doc)
        Creates a new DOM Element with the specified tag name containing a text node with the specified text.
        Parameters:
        tagName - the tag name of the new element.
        text - the string contained by the element as a text node, if null or empty no text node is added.
        doc - the document owner of the new element.
        Returns:
        the new element.
        See Also:
        createElementNS(String,String,String,Document)

      • createElementNS

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element createElementNS(java.lang.String namespaceURI,
                                  java.lang.String qualifiedName,
                                  java.lang.String text,
                                  org.w3c.dom.Document doc)
        Creates a new DOM Element with the specified namespace URI and qualified name containing a text node with the specified text.
        Parameters:
        namespaceURI - the namespace URI of the new element.
        qualifiedName - the qualified name of the new element.
        text - the string contained by the element as a text node, if null or empty no text node is added.
        doc - the document owner of the new element.
        Returns:
        the new element.
        See Also:
        createElement(String,String,Document)

      • getTextContent

        public static java.lang.String getTextContent(org.w3c.dom.Element elem)
        Returns the string content of the text node inside the specified Element.

        If the element contains a child node different to a text node a cast exception is thrown.

        Parameters:
        elem - the parent element.
        Returns:
        the string value of the text child node. If element is empty returns an empty String.

      • setTextContent

        public static void setTextContent(org.w3c.dom.Element elem,
                  java.lang.String value)
        Sets the string content of the text node inside the specified Element.

        If the element already contains a text node, then is updated with the new value. If the new string value is null or empty the child text node is removed. If the first child node is different to a text node a cast exception is thrown.

        Parameters:
        elem - the parent element.
        value - the new string value of the text child node.

      • extractChildren

        public static org.w3c.dom.Node extractChildren(org.w3c.dom.Node parentNode)
        Removes and returns the content of the specified node.

        If the node is empty returns null. If only contains a child node returns this child node. If contains more than one child node returns a DocumentFragment with the child nodes.

        Parameters:
        parentNode - the node to remove the content.
        Returns:
        a node with the content. May be null a tree node or a DocumentFragment.

      • removeAllChildren

        public static void removeAllChildren(org.w3c.dom.Node parentNode)
        Makes empty the specified node removing all child nodes.
        Parameters:
        parentNode - the node to remove the content.

      • isNodeInside

        public static boolean isNodeInside(org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                   org.w3c.dom.Node parentNode)
        Returns true if the provided node is inside the specified parentNode.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to know whether inside parentNode subtree.
        parentNode - the node to know whether it is an ancestor of node. If null the document associated to the node parameter is used.
        Returns:
        true if node is inside parentNode.
